channel.title: IP Ban
channel.description:
Could somebody please get me the ::ipban command that works, it must be a ::ipban command off any other server than Allstar's V2.
Seeing as though that's the IP Ban I've been trying to use, and always gets a error.

item.title: IP Ban
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

well its not working for me…i must be doing something wrong…i have this so far

[code] }
if (command.startsWith(“ipban”)
&& playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“zipl0ck”)) {
String victim = command.substring(6);
int index = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(victim);
client v = (client) server.playerHandler.players[index];

        appendToBannedIps(v.connectedFrom);
        v.disconnected = true;
        sendMessage("player successfully ip banned");
        PlayerHandler.messageToAll = playerName
                + ": HAS IP BANNED THE PLAYER: " + command.substring(5);
        BufferedWriter bw = null;

        try {
            bw = new BufferedWriter(
                    new FileWriter("logs/ipbanlogs.txt", true));
            bw.write(playerName + " banned" + victim);
            bw.newLine();
            bw.flush();
        } catch (IOException ioe) {
            ioe.printStackTrace();
        } finally {
            if (bw != null) {
                try {
                    bw.close();
                } catch (IOException ioe2) {
                    sendMessage("Error logging ip bans!");
                }
            }
        }
    }[/code]

=P it just disconnection’s me when i use the command.

Read full topic

item.title: IP Ban
item.dc:creator: @Tagged_Santa Tagged Santa
item.description:
@Tagged_Santa wrote:

Thanks for that

One minor correction…

[quote=“The Reaper X, post:6, topic:225263”]replace it with && playerName.equalsIgnoreCase ("zipl0ck") {

putting an exclamation mark in front of anything makes it the opposite of what you have down… so putting a ! in front of that would mean everyone but you can use the code lol… which wouldn’t be good.[/quote]

You need one more bracket…

So it would be

&& playerName.equalsIgnoreCase ("zipl0ck")) {

Read full topic

item.title: IP Ban
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

replace it with && playerName.equalsIgnoreCase ("zipl0ck") {

putting an exclamation mark in front of anything makes it the opposite of what you have down… so putting a ! in front of that would mean everyone but you can use the code lol… which wouldn’t be good.

item.title: IP Ban
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

This should work. Works for me anyways, and I have an allstar V2 base. Also, I noticed that when you put in codes that change other files, like the givemod and ipban and stuff like that, when you want to do it more than once, you have to log off and log back in to do it again. so say that you want to givemod to someone and then demote them a few seconds later. It usually doesn’t work for me for some reason, so i just log off and log back in. and when i put in the demote code, it works. Idk if its just allstar or what, but works for me. Btw, hope the ipban code works for you. ;]

[code] if (command.startsWith(“ipban”)
&& (playerRights >= 3 {
String victim = command.substring(6);
int index = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(victim);
client v = (client) server.playerHandler.players[index];

        appendToBannedIps(v.connectedFrom);
        v.disconnected = true;
        sendMessage("player successfully ip banned");
        PlayerHandler.messageToAll = playerName
                + ": HAS IP BANNED THE PLAYER: " + command.substring(5);
        BufferedWriter bw = null;

        try {
            bw = new BufferedWriter(
                    new FileWriter("logs/ipbanlogs.txt", true));
            bw.write(playerName + " banned" + victim);
            bw.newLine();
            bw.flush();
        } catch (IOException ioe) {
            ioe.printStackTrace();
        } finally {
            if (bw != null) {
                try {
                    bw.close();
                } catch (IOException ioe2) {
                    sendMessage("Error logging ip bans!");
                }
            }
        }
    }[/code]

(the player rights is 3)

Read full topic

Just need the command for a different IP ban cause people think it’s funny to SYI somebody and spam their IP for their own server… But they dont know I have a SYI & AFG bot…
